titles.title: Chacoan Outliers Protection Act of 1993
Chacoan Outliers Protection Act of 1993
Chacoan Outliers Protection Act of 1993
A bill to amend title V of Public Law 96-550, designating the Chaco Culture Archaelogical Protection Sites, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S1388-1390)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

action.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks. Hearings concluded. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 103-221.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 103-91.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 136.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.

bill.summary: 7/21/1993--Passed Senate amended. Chacoan Outliers Protection Act of 1993 - Designates seven new outlying areas as Chaco Culture Archaeological Protection Sites associated with Chacoan Anasazi Indian culture in the San Juan Basin and surrounding areas of New Mexico and Colorado. Expands the boundaries and removes or reduces the acreage of certain existing Sites. Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to assist the Navajo Nation in the protection and management of such Sites located on lands of the Navajos through a grant, contract, or cooperative agreement entered into pursuant to the Indian Self-Determination and Education Act.
